newsitem.title: UK: UK's Comino climbs to premium on AIM debut.
newsitem.headline: UK's Comino climbs to premium on AIM debut.

text.p: Shares in software application specialist Comino Plc climbed to a premium on Thursday in their first day of dealings on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM), dealers said.
The shares advanced 9-1/2p to 139-1/2p from the issue price of 130p by 1044 GMT.
Dealers said that trading volume was difficult to estimate but was over 200,000 shares.
Comino supplies computerised solutions to housing associations in the UK, to the fashion and clothing industry and the pension funds sector.

The company raised 1.53 million stg from the AIM float to fund strategic acquisitions and chief executive Garth Selvey said he believed Comino can make a significant impact in the fashion and clothing industry by increasing its size through acquisitions.
